item.name: Auth Salesforce API via Connected App

request.description:
Logs in to the login server and starts a client session.

Make sure to set the `url`, `username`, `password` and `secretToken` environment variables before sending this request.
On success, the request will automatically collect your authentication token for later use.

exec: pm.test('Validate the access token is found in the body and save it to the variables', () => {

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?>
<env:Envelope xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
    xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
    xmlns:n1="urn:partner.soap.sforce.com"
    xmlns:env="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
    <env:Header>
        <!--
        ensure API is enabled
        Administration Setup > Manage Users > Profiles > Users Profile > Administrative Permissions > API Enabled
        -->
        <n1:LoginScopeHeader>
            <n1:organizationId>{{orgId}}</n1:organizationId>
        </n1:LoginScopeHeader>
    </env:Header>
    <env:Body>
        <n1:login>
            <n1:username><![CDATA[{{buyerUsername}}]]></n1:username>
            <n1:password><![CDATA[{{buyerPassword}}]]></n1:password>
        </n1:login>
    </env:Body>
</env:Envelope>

request.description:
Logs in to the login server and starts a client session.

Make sure to set the `url`, `username`, `password` and `secretToken` environment variables before sending this request.
On success, the request will automatically collect your authentication token for later use.

item.name: 3. Login Buyer (optional, not needed for OOBO)

exec: pm.test('Validate the access token is found in the body and save it to the variables', () => {

body.raw:
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?>
<env:Envelope xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"
    xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
    xmlns:n1="urn:partner.soap.sforce.com"
    xmlns:env="http://schemas.xmlsoap.org/soap/envelope/">
    <env:Header>
        <!--
        ensure API is enabled
        Administration Setup > Manage Users > Profiles > Users Profile > Administrative Permissions > API Enabled
        -->
        <n1:LoginScopeHeader>
            <n1:organizationId>{{orgId}}</n1:organizationId>
        </n1:LoginScopeHeader>
    </env:Header>
    <env:Body>
        <n1:login>
            <n1:username><![CDATA[{{buyerUsername}}]]></n1:username>
            <n1:password><![CDATA[{{buyerPassword}}]]></n1:password>
        </n1:login>
    </env:Body>
</env:Envelope>
